archdesc.scopecontent: [The film] "takes a closer look at 'Ernie,' a boy from Oak Park, Illinois, spending his boyhood summers with his family at their cottage in Northern Michigan. Years later, Hemingway would incorporate his memories from the area into a collection of fictional stories about a boy named 'Nick Adams' who loved hunting, fishing, and friends in places like Petoskey and Horton Bay"--Case.
